topic.para: The syslog-ng-ctl credentials status command allows you to query the status of the private keys that &abbrev; uses in the network() and syslog() drivers. The command returns the list of private keys used, and their status. For example:
topic.synopsis: syslog-ng-ctl credentials status Secret store status: /home/user/ssl_test/client-1/client-encrypted.key SUCCESS
topic.para: If the status of a key is PENDING, you must provide the passphrase for the key, otherwise &abbrev; cannot use it. The &abbrev; application cannot use a log path if it requires a key that is in PENDING status. You must provide the passphrase of the password-protected keys every time &abbrev; is restarted.
